param.desc: Adds a @{WEAPON} or an @{ITEM} into the fav table
Add a binding to run when the button is pressed.
Adds an entry to the SettingsBindings table, to easily present them eg. in a GUI.
Finds the first button associated with a specific binding and returns the button. Returns KEY_NONE if no button is found.
Finds all buttons associated with a specific binding and returns the buttons. Returns an empty table if no button is found.
Returns the SettingsBindings table.
Returns the SettingsBindingsCategories table.
Returns a table of all the bindings

Register a function to run when the button for a specific binding is pressed. This will also add the binding to the BindingsCategories with the default category, otherwise set dontShowOrCategory to true. If you wish to set a custom category name then set dontShowOrCategory to the category name and optionally also set the label you wish to be displayed. You can set a default key as well, so players don't need to bind manually if they don't want to.
Removes the binding (button) with the given identifier.
Removes all bindings (buttons) associated with the given identifier.
Add a binding to run when the button is pressed and clears all previous buttons that are associated with this identifier.
Creates the fav table if it not already exists

Draws the disguise info on screen for the disguised Player
Get all favorites of a Player based on the subrole

param.desc: Determines if the given element instance is available/usable for this HUD. This will respect the @{HUDELEMENT}.disabledUnlessForced property and check if the parent element (if exists) is also available, otherwise this will return false.
Called to draw all elements, by calling the @{HUD:DrawElemAndChildren} function on all elements which aren't a child and have a HUDELEMENT.type (these are all non-base elements).

Called to draw an element and all its children, by calling the @{HUD:DrawElemAndChildren} function on them (recursive). This will also respect the HUDELEMENT.initialized attribute, the @{HUD:ShouldShow} result, the @{HUDELEMENT:ShouldDraw} result and the result of the hook "HUDShouldDraw". Additionally this function will call HUDEditor.DrawElem after the elements draw, to correctly display the HUDEditors elements on top.

This function will add an element to the forced elements for this HUD, so this will define the implementation used for a type. Use this on knonw elements you want to be shown in your HUD, so the HUD doesn't select the first implementation it finds.

Returns an element the HUD wants to use for a given type. It will only return an element, if the HUD 'has' the element. This will first evaluate, if there is a forcedElement for the given type, otherwise it will search all elements that match the type and find the first instance that 'can' be used, please take a look at @{HUD:CanUseElement} for the criteria / restrictions for the evaluation as if an element can be used.
This returns a table with all the specific elements the HUD has. One element per type, respecting the forcedElements and otherwise taking the first found implementation.
This will give you a copy of the forced elements table.
This function will return a table containing all keys that will be stored by the @{HUD:SaveData} function.
Returns wether or not the HUD has an element for the given type. See @{HUD:GetElementByType} for an explaination when a HUD 'has' an element.
This will set a type to be hidden. The element implementation for this type then will not be drawn anymore.

This will initialize the HUD, by calling @{HUDELEMENT:Initialize} on its elements, respecting the parent -> child relations. It will also call @{HUD:PerformLayout} before setting the HUDELEMENT.initialized parameter.

This function will load all saved keys from the Database and will then call @{HUDELEMENT:LoadData} on all elements, shown by the HUD. After that it will call @{HUD:PerformLayout}. This function is called when the HUDManager loads / changes to this HUD.

This will tell all elements in this HUD to recalculate their positions/sizes and other dependent variables. This is called whenever the HUD changes or loads new values either for itself (eg. basecolor) or for its children.
This will reset all elements of the HUD and call @{HUDELEMENT:Reset} on its elements. This will respect the parent -> child relation and only call this on non-child elements.
This will save all data of the HUD and its elements, by calling @{HUDELEMENT:SaveData} on them. This is usually called when changing the current HUD or editing a HUD in the HUDEditor.

This will determine if an element type is supposed to be displayed, by checking if @{HUD:GetElementByType} will return an element table, so the HUD actually "has" the element, and checking if the element is toggled on/off with its clientside ConVar.
This function adds a child to your list of children. Children functions will be called whenever a parent function is called , e.g., in @{PerformLayout}
This function will try to call the function given with funcName on all children of this hud element, while also passing extra parameters to this the function.

[opt] ... parameters to call the given function with

param.desc: Checks whether an hud element's aspect ratio is locked. Override it to change the behaviour.
This function is called when an element should draw its content. Please use this function only to draw your element and dont calculate any values if not explicitly needed.
Draws the hovered @{OnHovered} areas of the hud element in a specific color
Draws the size of the hud element (borders in red)
This function returns your basepos, the value which is used to move the element.
param.treturn: table with x and y value

param.desc: Get the position and the size of an hud element
This function gives you a copy of all your children
param.treturn: table a copy of all your child elements

param.desc: Returns the clicked area of an hud element
This function is called when an element wants to now its original position. This is the case at @{Reset} and @{Initialize}. You should overwrite this with your own calculated values!
param.treturn: table with basepos, size and minsize fields

param.desc: This function returns your minsize, the value which is used as a minimum when resizing the element. Note: Setting the size with @{SetSize} allows smaller values.
param.treturn: table with width and height value

param.desc:
This function returns the current parent together with its type.

!!! INTERNAL FUNCTION !!!
This function returns your pos, the value which is used internally to define the upper left corner of the element
param.treturn: table with x and y value

param.desc: Getter for saving keys
This function returns your size.
param.treturn: table with width and height value

param.desc: Checks whether an hud element's borders are inherited by it's parent. Override it to change the resizing behaviour.

This function will be called each time the HUD is loaded eg. when switching to this HUD in the HUDManager, so expect this function to be called multiple times and respect that within your code. Due to this, the function should be used to reset your member variables and temporary variables. Then you can set them to an useful inital value. Remember that previously loaded values will be applied later and dont forget to call BaseClass.@{Initialize}(self), which will then call @{Initialize} on all children.
This function gives you information about whether it has a parent or not
Checks whether an hud element is in position (same as @{IsInRange}, but without any padding)
Checks whether an hud element is in range
This function gives you information about whether it has child elements or not
Checks whether an hud element is resizeable. Override it to change the resizing behaviour.
Loads the saved keys and applies them to the element
Returns the hovered area of an hud element
This function is called after all @{Initialize} functions and whenever the layout was changed, i.e., size, position.

This function will be called after all hud elements have been loaded and are registered. But be aware that the elements are still "raw", so they did not execute any code or set any of their properties correct. Use this function for example to register your child -> parent relation, by calling @{hudelements.RegisterChildRelation}(childid, parentid, parent_is_type) and also to force your element to a specific HUD if needed etc...
This function uses @{GetDefaults} to reset an element to its original position.
http://wiki.garrysmod.com/?title=Creating_a_HUD
Saves the current savingkey values (position, size)
This function sets your basepos, the value which is used to move the element. It automatically updates the position as well with @{SetPos}
This function sets your minsize, the value which is used as a minimum when resizing the element. Note: Setting the size with @{SetSize} allows smaller values.
Sets the mouse clicked state

This function is used internally and only has the full effect if called by the hudelements.RegisterChildRelation() function.

!!! INTERNAL FUNCTION !!!
This function sets your pos, the value which is used internally to define the upper left corner of the element

This function sets your size. Note: When passing negative values it will call @{SetPos} to shift your element by the value. This results in i.e. in a top growing element instead of the default bottom growing when setting -h instead of h.
This function is called to decide whether or not an element should be drawn. Override it to let your element be drawn only in specific situations.
Looks for weapon id in favorites table (result of GetFavorites)
A player or NPC has bought the @{ITEM}
Draw some information in a small box next to the icon in the hud if a Player is owning this @{ITEM}
A player or NPC has picked the @{ITEM} up
useable, but do not modify this!
param.treturn: boolean whether this @{ITEM} is an equipment

param.desc: Called just before entity is deleted. This is used to reset data you set before
Removes a @{WEAPON} or an @{ITEM} into the fav table

Custom weapon base, used to derive from CS one, still very similar. See Weapon TTT SPECIAL EQUIPMENT FIELDS This must be set to one of the WEAPON_ types in TTT weapons for weapon carrying limits to work properly. See /gamemode/shared.lua for all possible weapon categories. If CanBuy is a table that contains ROLE_TRAITOR and/or ROLE_DETECTIVE, those players are allowed to purchase it and it will appear in their Equipment Menu for that purpose. If CanBuy is nil this weapon cannot be bought. Example: SWEP.CanBuy = { ROLE_TRAITOR } (just setting to nil here to document its existence, don't make this buyable) If this is a buyable weapon (ie. CanBuy is not nil) EquipMenuData must be a table containing some information to show in the Equipment Menu. See default equipment weapons for real-world examples. Example data: SWEP.EquipMenuData = { Type tells players if it's a weapon or item type = "Weapon", Desc is the description in the menu. Needs manual linebreaks (via \n). desc = "Text." } This sets the icon shown for the weapon in the DNA sampler, search window, equipment menu (if buyable), etc. You can make your own weapon icon using the template in: /garrysmod/gamemodes/terrortown/template/ Open one of TTT's icons with VTFEdit to see what kind of settings to use when exporting to VTF. Once you have a VTF and VMT, you can resource.AddFile("materials/vgui/...") them here. GIVE YOUR ICON A UNIQUE FILENAME, or it WILL be overwritten by other servers! Gmod does not check if the files are different, it only looks at the name. I recommend you create your own directory so that this does not happen, eg. /materials/vgui/ttt/mycoolserver/mygun.vmt MISC TTT-SPECIFIC BEHAVIOUR CONFIGURATION ALL weapons in TTT must have weapon_tttbase as their SWEP.Base. It provides some functions that TTT expects, and you will get errors without them. Of course this is weapon_tttbase itself, so I comment this out here. SWEP.Base = "weapon_tttbase" If true AND SWEP.Kind is not WEAPON_EQUIP, then this gun can be spawned as random weapon by a ttt_random_weapon entity. Set to true if weapon can be manually dropped by players (with Q) Set to true if weapon kills silently (no death scream) If this weapon should be given to players upon spawning, set a table of the roles this should happen for here SWEP.InLoadoutFor = {ROLE_TRAITOR, ROLE_DETECTIVE, ROLE_INNOCENT} use the Initialize hook to be able to use custom ROLE_XXX vars DO NOT set SWEP.WeaponID. Only the standard TTT weapons can have it. Custom SWEPs do not need it for anything. SWEP.WeaponID = nil YE OLDE SWEP STUFF crosshair

Generates a new subrole id. starts with 1 to prevent incompatibilities with ROLE_ANY => new roles will start at the id: 7
  • 0 = ROLE_INNOCENT
  • 1 = ROLE_TRAITOR
  • 2 = ROLE_DETECTIVE
  • 3 = ROLE_ANY
  • 4, 5, 6 = nop
